title: Workshop for Adjusting Socio-Occupational Education Design Through Student Pharmacist Motivation Measurement

context.prior_knowledge: Basic pharmaceutical knowledge, general understanding of instructional design concepts, and foundational awareness of social and vocational educational environments
context.additional_context: A course for current professionals enhancing motivation measurement tools and instructional design improvement capabilities, supporting learners' awareness of rights and professional identity formation.

learning_goals: Operation and analysis of a survey tool (MUSIC Model) measuring learner motivation levels with 80% accuracy to improve educational systems.
Derivation of at least three educational design adjustment strategies based on survey results and their application to socio-professional contexts.
Integration of data evaluating learning motivation factors (interest, utility, confidence, etc.) with project-based assessments and reflection in civic competency enhancement.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
